Improve this doc View source

stPagination
directive in module stPagination

Description

Directive that display a pagination for an array that is initialized by the stPagination filter.

   <st-pagination collection="users"></st-pagination>

Configure number of displayed page links

The automatic folding of indices can be configured. The number of the displayed page links are set with the attributes midRange and `edgeRange. If the page links overlap they are summed up to keep a fixed length. The overlapped element a replaced by '...' and a click on that pagination element will jump to the middle of the folded elements.

   <st-pagination collection="users" mid-range="2" edge-range="3"></st-pagination>

Configure structure for css

Configure the html structure for you css with the parameter cssConfig. As parameter you can pass a {string} key for configuration presets or an custom configuration as {object}.

The generated default structure of the directive is a simple list with links and a pagination class. The current page link has an active class and the previous and next buttons get a disabled class for the first or last page.

  <ul class="pagination">
    <li class="disabled"><a>«</a></li>
    <li class="active"><a>1</a></li>
    <li><a>1</a></li>
    <li><a>2</a></li>
    <li><a>3</a></li>
    <li><a>»</a></li>
  </ul>

The config property {divWrapped: true} or the key 'divWrappedList' wraps the list in a div element.

  <div class="pagination">
    <ul>
      ...
    </ul>
  </div>

The config properties selectedClass and disabledClass replace the class attributes for the list elements.

   <st-pagination collection="users" css-config="{selectedClass: 'current', disabledClass: 'unavailable'}">
   </st-pagination>

For example {selectedClass: 'current', disabledClass: 'unavailable'} will generate the following html structure.

  <ul class="pagination">
    <li class="current"><a>«</a></li>
    <li class="unavailable"><a>1</a></li>
    <li><a>1</a></li>
    <li><a>2</a></li>
    <li><a>3</a></li>
    <li><a>»</a></li>
  </ul>
Config keys for css frameworks

To simplify the configuration for popular css framework just use a {string} key for the configuration.

  • 'bootstrap3' generates the default structure
  • 'bootstrap2' generates a 'divWrappedList'
  • 'zurbFoundation' set class attributes necessary for foundation (works with version 3-5)
   <st-pagination collection="users" css-config="'zurbFoundation'"></st-pagination>

Usage

as element:
<st-pagination
       collection="{Array}"
       [mid-range="{number}"]
       [edge-range="{number}"]
       [css-config="{object|string}"]>
</st-pagination>

Parameters

ParamTypeDetails
collectionArray

Array that was initialized by the stPagination filter

midRange
(optional)
number

Number of page links before and after current index

(default: 3)

edgeRange
(optional)
number

Number of page links at the start and end

(default: 3)

cssConfig
(optional)
objectstring

Custom {object} to configure the html structure or {string} key for a predefined configuration.

Config {object} properties:

  • divWrapped - {boolean} - if true the pagination list will be wrapped with a div element (Default: false)
  • selectedClass - {string} - set as class attribute for the li element of the selected page (Default: 'active')
  • disabledClass - {string} - set as class attribute to disable previous and next elements on first and last page (Default: 'disabled')

Config {string} keys:

  • 'list'
  • 'divWrappedList'
  • 'bootstrap3' alias for 'list'
  • 'bootstrap2' alias for 'divWrappedList'
  • 'zurbFoundation' - custom configuration for zurb

(default: 'list')
